ianoid wrote:
>>
Here's a little bit about the Astrocade, in case it hasn't=
 been brought to everyone's attention [from Creative Computing Magazine (Se=
ptember 1980) Volume 06 Number 09]:


https://archive.org/stream/creativeco=
mputing-1980-09/Creative_Computing_v06_n09_1980_Sep#page/n41/mode/2up

>>

=
As I've said before, I've always considered these two, short columns must-r=
eads. They allow us to glimpse what many 70s-era computer systems were alre=
ady facing: computer obsolesce.  Where did Bally Arcade owners have to turn=
 in 1980 and 1981 when it was hard to find information on those systems?  A=
nother article along these lines is Astrocade's Underground by Danny Goodma=
n from the September 1983 issue of Joystik:


http://www.ballyalley.com/art=
icles_and_news/articles_and_news.html#AstrocadeUndergroundArticle


The Bal=
ly system had it hard, and it always amazes me that it survived for long.

=
Adam

--_000_CY4PR1601MB11415AF6EBE55EE242D750EBC8890CY4PR1601MB1141_

ianoid wrote:<br>
>=
><br>
Here's a little bit about the Astrocade, in case it hasn't been br=
ought to everyone's attention [from Creative Computing Magazine (September =
1980) Volume 06 Number 09]:<br>
<br>
<p><a href=3D"https://archive.org/stre=
am/creativecomputing-1980-09/Creative_Computing_v06_n09_1980_Sep#page/n41/m=
ode/2up" class=3D"OWAAutoLink" id=3D"LPlnk647364" previewremoved=3D"true">h=
ttps://archive.org/stream/creativecomputing-1980-09/Creative_Computing_v06_=
n09_1980_Sep#page/n41/mode/2up</a></p>
>><br>
<br>
As I've said befor=
e, I've always considered these two, short columns must-reads. They allow u=
s to glimpse what many 70s-era computer systems were already facing: comput=
er obsolesce.  Where did Bally Arcade owners have to turn in 1980 and =
1981 when it was hard
 to find information on those systems?  Another =
article along these lines is <i>Astrocade's Underground</i> by Danny Goodma=
n from the September 1983 issue of
<i>Joystik</i>:<br>
<br>
<p><a href=3D"h=
ttp://www.ballyalley.com/articles_and_news/articles_and_news.html#Astrocade=
UndergroundArticle" class=3D"OWAAutoLink" id=3D"LPlnk559726" previewremoved=
=3D"true">http://www.ballyalley.com/articles_and_news/articles_and_news.htm=
l#AstrocadeUndergroundArticle</a></p>
<p><br>
</p>
<p>The Bally system had =
it hard, and it always amazes me that it survived for long.<br>
</p>
<br>
A=
dam<br>
</div>

</html>
